summary.span: 表示非同步作業。

span.span: Represents an asynchronous operation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 類別的代表單一作業不會傳回值，而此通常以非同步方式執行。The class represents a single operation that does not return a value and that usually executes asynchronously. 物件是其中一個的中央元件[工作式非同步模式](~/docs/standard/asynchronous-programming-patterns/task-based-asynchronous-pattern-tap.md)首度引進.NET Framework 4 中。 objects are one of the central components of the [task-based asynchronous pattern](~/docs/standard/asynchronous-programming-patterns/task-based-asynchronous-pattern-tap.md) first introduced in the .NET Framework 4. 因為所執行的工作物件通常是以非同步方式執行的執行緒集區執行緒上而不是以同步方式在主應用程式執行緒中，您可以使用屬性，以及， ，及屬性，以判斷工作的狀態。Because the work performed by a object typically executes asynchronously on a thread pool thread rather than synchronously on the main application thread, you can use the property, as well as the , , and properties, to determine the state of a task. 大多數情況下，lambda 運算式用來指定工作可執行的工作。Most commonly, a lambda expression is used to specify the work that the task is to perform. 對於傳回值的作業，您使用類別。For operations that return values, you use the class. 本節內容：In this section: [工作具現化範例](#Instant) [Task instantiation examples](#Instant) [建立和執行工作](#Creating) [Creating and executing a task](#Creating) [區隔工作建立和執行](#Separating) [Separating task creation and execution](#Separating) [等候完成的一或多個工作](#WaitingForOne) [Waiting for one or more tasks to complete](#WaitingForOne) [工作和文化特性](#Culture) [Tasks and culture](#Culture) [適用於偵錯工具開發人員For debugger developers](#Debugger) ## 工作具現化Task instantiation 下列範例會建立，並執行四項工作。The following example creates and executes four tasks. 三個工作執行名為委派`action`，它可接受類型的引數。Three tasks execute an delegate named `action`, which accepts an argument of type . 第四個工作執行 lambda 運算式 (委派) 也就是內嵌定義的工作建立方法的呼叫中。A fourth task executes a lambda expression (an delegate) that is defined inline in the call to the task creation method. 每個工作是具現化，並以不同方式執行：Each task is instantiated and run in a different way: - 工作`t1`藉由呼叫的工作類別建構函式具現化，但啟動藉由呼叫其方法，只有在工作之後`t2`已啟動。Task `t1` is instantiated by calling a Task class constructor, but is started by calling its method only after task `t2` has started. - 任務`t2`就會具現化，並啟動單一方法呼叫中，藉由呼叫方法。Task `t2` is instantiated and started in a single method call by calling the method. - 任務`t3`就會具現化，並啟動單一方法呼叫中，藉由呼叫方法。Task `t3` is instantiated and started in a single method call by calling the method. - 任務`t4`藉由呼叫在主執行緒上同步執行方法。Task `t4` is executed synchronously on the main thread by calling the method. 因為工作`t4`執行以同步方式，它會在主應用程式的執行緒上執行。Because task `t4` executes synchronously, it executes on the main application thread. 其餘的工作以非同步方式執行通常在一或多個執行緒集區執行緒上。The remaining tasks execute asynchronously typically on one or more thread pool threads. [!code-csharp[System.Threading.Tasks.Task#01](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task/cs/startnew.cs#01)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.Tasks.Task#01](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task/vb/startnew.vb#01)] ## 建立和執行工作Creating and executing a task 執行個體可能會建立各種不同的方式。 instances may be created in a variety of ways. 最常見的方法，起[!INCLUDE[net_v45](~/includes/net-v45-md.md)]，方法是呼叫靜態方法。The most common approach, which is available starting with the [!INCLUDE[net_v45](~/includes/net-v45-md.md)], is to call the static method. 方法提供簡單的方式來啟動工作，使用預設值且不需要額外的參數。The method provides a simple way to start a task using default values and without requiring additional parameters. 下列範例會使用方法來啟動工作並執行迴圈，然後顯示迴圈反覆項目數目：The following example uses the method to start a task that loops and then displays the number of loop iterations: [!code-csharp[System.Threading.Tasks.Task#6](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task/cs/run1.cs#6)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.Tasks.Task#6](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task/vb/run1.vb#6)] 替代方式，以及最常見的方法，來啟動工作以[!INCLUDE[net_v40_short](~/includes/net-v40-short-md.md)]，是靜態方法。An alternative, and the most common method to start a task in [!INCLUDE[net_v40_short](~/includes/net-v40-short-md.md)], is the static method. 屬性會傳回物件。The property returns a object. 多載方法可讓您指定要傳遞至工作建立選項和工作排程器的參數。Overloads of the method let you specify parameters to pass to the task creation options and a task scheduler. 下列範例會使用啟動工作的方法。The following example uses the method to start a task. 它相當於前一個範例中的程式碼。It is functionally equivalent to the code in the previous example. [!code-csharp[System.Threading.Tasks.Task#7](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task/cs/startnew1.cs#7)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.Tasks.Task#7](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task/vb/startnew1.vb#7)] 如需更完整的範例，請參閱 < [ 工作式非同步程式設計](~/docs/standard/parallel-programming/task-based-asynchronous-programming.md)。For more complete examples, see [Task-based Asynchronous Programming](~/docs/standard/parallel-programming/task-based-asynchronous-programming.md). ## 區隔工作建立和執行Separating task creation and execution 類別也會提供建構函式所初始化的工作，但是，不要排程它執行。The class also provides constructors that initialize the task but that do not schedule it for execution. 基於效能考量或方法是慣用的機制，建立和排程計算工作，但其中必須以建立和排程的情況下，您可以使用建構函式，然後呼叫方法排定在稍後執行的工作。For performance reasons, the or method is the preferred mechanism for creating and scheduling computational tasks, but for scenarios where creation and scheduling must be separated, you can use the constructors and then call the method to schedule the task for execution at a later time. ## 等候完成的一或多個工作Waiting for one or more tasks to complete 因為工作通常會在執行緒集區執行緒上以非同步方式執行，會建立並啟動工作的執行緒會繼續執行，只要工作具現化。Because tasks typically run asynchronously on a thread pool thread, the thread that creates and starts the task continues execution as soon as the task has been instantiated. 在某些情況下，當呼叫的執行緒是主應用程式執行緒，應用程式可能會終止任何之前工作實際開始執行。In some cases, when the calling thread is the main application thread, the app may terminate before any the task actually begins execution. 在其他使用案例，您的應用程式邏輯可能需要當呼叫端執行緒只在一或多個工作完成執行時，才會繼續執行。In others, your application's logic may require that the calling thread continue execution only when one or more tasks has completed execution. 您可以同步處理執行呼叫的執行緒和非同步工作就會啟動藉由呼叫`Wait`等候完成的一或多個工作的方法。You can synchronize the execution of the calling thread and the asynchronous tasks it launches by calling a `Wait` method to wait for one or more tasks to complete. 若要等候單一工作完成時，您可以呼叫其方法。To wait for a single task to complete, you can call its method. 呼叫方法會封鎖呼叫執行緒，直到執行完成的單一類別執行個體。A call to the method blocks the calling thread until the single class instance has completed execution. 下列範例會呼叫無參數無條件地等候，直到工作完成的方法。The following example calls the parameterless method to wait unconditionally until a task completes. 工作模擬的工作，藉由呼叫兩秒進入睡眠狀態的方法。The task simulates work by calling the method to sleep for two seconds. [!code-csharp[System.Threading.Tasks.Task#8](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task/cs/Wait1.cs#8)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.Tasks.Task#8](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task/vb/Wait1.vb#8)] 您可以也有條件地等候工作完成。You can also conditionally wait for a task to complete. 和方法會封鎖呼叫執行緒，直到工作完成或經過逾時間隔，視何者先。The and methods block the calling thread until the task finishes or a timeout interval elapses, whichever comes first. 因為下列範例會啟動的工作，會進入睡眠狀態兩秒，但定義一秒等候逾時值，則呼叫端執行緒會封鎖直到逾時到期，以及之前工作已完成執行。Since the following example launches a task that sleeps for two seconds but defines a one-second timeout value, the calling thread blocks until the timeout expires and before the task has completed execution. [!code-csharp[System.Threading.Tasks.Task#9](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task/cs/Wait2.cs#9)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.Tasks.Task#9](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task/vb/Wait2.vb#9)] 您也可以藉由呼叫提供的取消語彙基元和方法。You can also supply a cancellation token by calling the and methods. 如果語彙基元屬性是`true`或變成`true`雖然方法正在執行時，此方法會擲回。If the token's property is `true` or becomes `true` while the method is executing, the method throws an . 在某些情況下，您可能想要等待執行工作的一系列的第一，若要完成，但不是這項工作的照護。In some cases, you may want to wait for the first of a series of executing tasks to complete, but don't care which task it is. 基於此目的，您可以呼叫其中一個多載方法。For this purpose, you can call one of the overloads of the method. 下列範例會建立三項工作，其中每個處於睡眠狀態的間隔來判斷隨機數字產生器。The following example creates three tasks, each of which sleeps for an interval determine by a random number generator. 方法會等候第一個工作完成。The method waits for the first task to complete. 範例接著會顯示所有三項工作的狀態相關資訊。The example then displays information about the status of all three tasks. [!code-csharp[System.Threading.Tasks.Task#10](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task/cs/WhenAny1.cs#10)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.Tasks.Task#10](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task/vb/WaitAny1.vb#10)] 您也可以等待一系列的工作完成藉由呼叫的所有方法。You can also wait for all of a series of tasks to complete by calling the method. 下列範例會建立 10 個工作、 等候所有十個完成，然後顯示其狀態。The following example creates ten tasks, waits for all ten to complete, and then displays their status. [!code-csharp[System.Threading.Tasks.Task#11](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task/cs/WaitAll1.cs#11)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.Tasks.Task#11](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task/vb/WaitAll1.vb#11)] 請注意當您等候一或多個工作完成時，在執行中的工作中擲回任何例外狀況會傳播呼叫的執行緒上`Wait`方法，如下列範例所示。Note that when you wait for one or more tasks to complete, any exceptions thrown in the running tasks are propagated on the thread that calls the `Wait` method, as the following example shows. 它會啟動 12 的工作，其中三個正常完成和三個例外狀況的擲回。It launches 12 tasks, three of which complete normally and three of which throw an exception. 其餘的六個工作中，三個，並取消之前開始，以及三個同時執行，並取消。Of the remaining six tasks, three are cancelled before the start, and three are cancelled while they executing. 中擲回例外狀況方法呼叫，並會由`try` / `catch`區塊。Exceptions are thrown in the method call and are handled by a `try`/`catch` block. [!code-csharp[System.Threading.Tasks.Task#12](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task/cs/WaitAll2.cs#12)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.Tasks.Task#12](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task/vb/WaitAll2.vb#12)] 如需有關以工作為基礎的非同步作業中的例外狀況處理的詳細資訊，請參閱[例外狀況處理](~/docs/standard/parallel-programming/exception-handling-task-parallel-library.md)。For more information on exception handling in task-based asynchronous operations, see [Exception Handling](~/docs/standard/parallel-programming/exception-handling-task-parallel-library.md). ## 工作和文化特性Tasks and culture 從桌面應用程式為目標[!INCLUDE[net_v46](~/includes/net-v46-md.md)]，建立並叫用工作之執行緒的文化特性會變成的執行緒內容的一部分。Starting with desktop apps that target the [!INCLUDE[net_v46](~/includes/net-v46-md.md)], the culture of the thread that creates and invokes a task becomes part of the thread's context. 也就是工作的目前執行緒文化特性執行該工作，不論目前的文化特性是工作的呼叫執行緒的文化特性。That is, regardless of the current culture of the thread on which the task executes, the current culture of the task is the culture of the calling thread. 之前的.NET Framework 版本為目標的應用程式的[!INCLUDE[net_v46](~/includes/net-v46-md.md)]，工作的文化特性是執行該工作之執行緒的文化特性。For apps that target versions of the .NET Framework prior to the [!INCLUDE[net_v46](~/includes/net-v46-md.md)], the culture of the task is the culture of the thread on which the task executes. 如需詳細資訊，請參閱 「 文化特性和以工作為基礎的非同步作業 > 一節中主題。For more information, see the "Culture and task-based asynchronous operations" section in the topic. > [!NOTE] > 市集應用程式，請遵循 Windows 執行階段設定和取得預設文化特性。Store apps follow the Windows Runtime in setting and getting the default culture. ## 適用於偵錯工具開發人員For debugger developers 適用於實作自訂的偵錯工具的開發人員，數個內部與私用成員的工作可能很有用 （這些可能會變更版本）。For developers implementing custom debuggers, several internal and private members of task may be useful (these may change from release to release). `m_taskId`欄位做為備份存放區屬性，不過存取這個欄位，直接從偵錯工具可能會比透過屬性的 getter 方法中存取相同的值更有效率 (`s_taskIdCounter`計數器用來擷取工作的下一個可用識別碼。）The `m_taskId` field serves as the backing store for the property, however accessing this field directly from a debugger may be more efficient than accessing the same value through the property's getter method (the `s_taskIdCounter` counter is used to retrieve the next available ID for a task). 同樣地，`m_stateFlags`欄位會儲存目前的生命週期階段相關的工作，也可透過存取資訊的資訊屬性。Similarly, the `m_stateFlags` field stores information about the current lifecycle stage of the task, information also accessible through the property. `m_action`欄位會儲存工作的委派的參考和`m_stateObject`欄位儲存開發人員所要傳遞給工作的非同步狀態。The `m_action` field stores a reference to the task's delegate, and the `m_stateObject` field stores the async state passed to the task by the developer. 最後，針對剖析堆疊框架的偵錯工具`InternalWait`方法做為工作進入等候作業的潛在標記。Finally, for debuggers that parse stack frames, the `InternalWait` method serves a potential marker for when a task is entering a wait operation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 而不是呼叫此建構函式，最常見的方式來具現化物件和啟動工作是藉由呼叫靜態或方法。Rather than calling this constructor, the most common way to instantiate a object and launch a task is by calling the static or method. 這個建構函式所提供的唯一優點是它可讓工作引動過程可以區隔的物件具現化。The only advantage offered by this constructor is that it allows object instantiation to be separated from task invocation. ## Examples 下列範例會使用建構函式來建立工作，以擷取中的檔名指定的目錄。The following example uses the constructor to create tasks that retrieve the filenames in specified directories. 所有工作將檔案名稱都寫入單一物件。All tasks write the file names to a single object. 此範例接著會呼叫方法，以確保所有工作完成時，，，然後顯示 檔案名稱寫入總數的計數物件。The example then calls the method to ensure that all tasks have completed, and then displays a count of the total number of file names written to the object. [!code-csharp[System.Threading.Tasks.Task.Ctor#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task.ctor/cs/ctor1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.Tasks.Task.Ctor#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task.ctor/vb/ctor1.vb#1)] 下列範例完全相同，不同之處在於它使用方法來具現化，並在單一作業中執行的工作。The following example is identical, except that it used the method to instantiate and run the task in a single operation. 此方法會傳回代表工作的物件。The method returns the object that represents the task. [!code-csharp[System.Threading.Tasks.Task.Run#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task.run/cs/run2.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.Tasks.Task.Run#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task.run/vb/run2.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 而不是呼叫此建構函式，最常見的方式來具現化物件和啟動工作是藉由呼叫靜態和方法。Rather than calling this constructor, the most common way to instantiate a object and launch a task is by calling the static and methods. 這個建構函式所提供的唯一優點是它可讓工作引動過程可以區隔的物件具現化。The only advantage offered by this constructor is that it allows object instantiation to be separated from task invocation. 如需詳細資訊，請參閱 < [ 工作平行處理原則 （工作平行程式庫）](~/docs/standard/parallel-programming/task-based-asynchronous-programming.md)並[受控執行緒中的取消](~/docs/standard/threading/cancellation-in-managed-threads.md)。For more information, see [Task Parallelism (Task Parallel Library)](~/docs/standard/parallel-programming/task-based-asynchronous-programming.md) and [Cancellation in Managed Threads](~/docs/standard/threading/cancellation-in-managed-threads.md). ## Examples 下列範例會呼叫建構函式建立的工作，會逐一查看 C:\Windows\System32 目錄中的檔案。The following example calls the constructor to create a task that iterates the files in the C:\Windows\System32 directory. Lambda 運算式呼叫方法來新增每個檔案的相關資訊物件。The lambda expression calls the method to add information about each file to a object. 每個中斷連結的巢狀的工作所叫用迴圈會檢查的取消語彙基元的狀態，以及如果要求取消，則會呼叫方法。Each detached nested task invoked by the loop checks the state of the cancellation token and, if cancellation is requested, calls the method. 方法會擲回會在處理的例外狀況`catch`封鎖呼叫執行緒呼叫時方法。The method throws an exception that is handled in a `catch` block when the calling thread calls the method. 方法接著會呼叫啟動工作。The method is then called to start the task. [!code-csharp[System.Threading.Tasks.Task.ctor#4](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task.ctor/cs/run4.cs#4)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.Tasks.Task.ctor#4](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task.ctor/vb/run4.vb#4)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 傳回將不會排定執行目前的工作完成之前，是否因為成功執行到完成、 失敗，因為發生未處理的例外狀況，或提早結束出因取消才完成。The returned will not be scheduled for execution until the current task has completed, whether it completes due to running to completion successfully, faulting due to an unhandled exception, or exiting out early due to being canceled. ## Examples 下列範例會定義的工作，會填入具有 100 隨機的日期和時間值的陣列。The following example defines a task that populates an array with 100 random date and time values. 它會使用陣列會完全擴展之後，選取最早和最新的日期值的方法。It uses the method to select the earliest and the latest date values once the array is fully populated. [!code-csharp[System.Threading.Tasks.Task.ContinueWith#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task.continuewith/cs/continuewith1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.Tasks.Task.ContinueWith#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task.continuewith/vb/continuewith1.vb#1)] 主控台應用程式可能會終止之前執行的接續工作，因為方法會呼叫以確保執行範例結束前完成的接續。Because a console application may terminate before the continuation task executes, the method is called to ensure that the continuation finishes executing before the example ends. 如需其他範例，請參閱 < [ 使用接續工作鏈結工作](~/docs/standard/parallel-programming/chaining-tasks-by-using-continuation-tasks.md)。For an additional example, see [Chaining Tasks by Using Continuation Tasks](~/docs/standard/parallel-programming/chaining-tasks-by-using-continuation-tasks.md).

remarks.format: ## Remarks 傳回將不會排定執行直到完成目前的工作。The returned will not be scheduled for execution until the current task has completed. 如果接續準則指定透過`continuationOptions`不符合參數，即會取消接續工作而不是排程。If the continuation criteria specified through the `continuationOptions` parameter are not met, the continuation task will be canceled instead of scheduled. ## Examples 下列範例示範如何使用來指定前項工作完成時的接續工作應該會以同步方式執行。The following example demonstrates using to specify that a continuation task should run synchronously when the antecedent task completes. (如果指定的工作已完成的時間呼叫時，同步執行緒呼叫上執行接續。)(If the specified task has already completed by the time is called, the synchronous continuation will run on the thread calling .) ```csharp public class TaskCounter { private volatile int _count; public void Track(Task t) { if (t == null) throw new ArgumentNullException("t"); Interlocked.Increment(ref _count); t.ContinueWith(ct => Interlocked.Decrement(ref _count), TaskContinuationOptions.ExecuteSynchronously); } public int NumberOfActiveTasks { get { return _count; } } } ``` ```vb Public Class TaskCounter Private _count as Integer Public Sub Track(ByVal t as Task) If t is Nothing Then Throw New ArgumentNullException("t") Interlocked.Increment(_count) t.ContinueWith(Sub(ct) Interlocked.Decrement(_count) End Sub, TaskContinuationOptions.ExecuteSynchronously) End Sub Public ReadOnly Property NumberOfActiveTasks As Integer Get Return _count End Get End Property End Class ```

remarks.format: ## Remarks 已`static`(`Shared` Visual Basic 中) 用來取得目前執行之工作的識別碼與工作正在執行的程式碼的屬性。 is a `static` (`Shared` in Visual Basic) property that is used to get the identifier of the currently executing task from the code that the task is executing. 不同於屬性，會傳回特定的識別項執行個體。It differs from the property, which returns the identifier of a particular instance. 如果您嘗試擷取從外部工作正在執行的程式碼的值，這個屬性會傳回`null`。If you attempt to retrieve the value from outside the code that a task is executing, the property returns `null`. 請注意，雖然衝突情況非常罕見，工作識別碼不保證是唯一的。Note that although collisions are very rare, task identifiers are not guaranteed to be unique.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法通常用來在指定的時間間隔內延遲的所有作業或工作的一部分。The method is typically used to delay the operation of all or part of a task for a specified time interval. 大多數情況下，已導入的時間延遲：Most commonly, the time delay is introduced: - 在開頭的工作，如下列範例顯示。At the beginning of the task, as the following example shows. [!code-csharp[System.Threading.Tasks.Task.Delay#5](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task.delay/cs/delay5.cs#5)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.Tasks.Task.Delay#5](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task.delay/vb/delay5.vb#5)] - 有時在工作時正在執行。Sometime while the task is executing. 在此情況下，呼叫方法會執行子工作中一項工作，如下列範例所示。In this case, the call to the method executes as a child task within a task, as the following example shows. 請注意，此工作之後，呼叫方法以非同步方式執行時，父工作必須等候它完成使用`await`關鍵字。Note that since the task that calls the method executes asynchronously, the parent task must wait for it to complete by using the `await` keyword. [!code-csharp[System.Threading.Tasks.Task.Delay#7](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task.delay/cs/delay5.cs#7)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.Tasks.Task.Delay#7](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task.delay/vb/delay5.vb#7)] 指定的時間延遲之後，在完成工作狀態。After the specified time delay, the task is completed in the state. 這個方法會取決於系統時鐘。This method depends on the system clock. 這表示時間延遲會大約等於系統時鐘的解析度如果`millisecondsDelay`引數小於系統時鐘，也就是在 Windows 系統上的大約 15 毫秒的解析度。This means that the time delay will approximately equal the resolution of the system clock if the `millisecondsDelay` argument is less than the resolution of the system clock, which is approximately 15 milliseconds on Windows systems. ## Examples 下列範例示範的簡易使用方法。The following example shows a simple use of the method. [!code-csharp[System.Threading.Tasks.Task.Delay#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task.delay/cs/delay1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.Tasks.Task.Delay#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task.delay/vb/delay1.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 擲回未處理的例外狀況的工作儲存產生的例外狀況，並將它包裝在散佈呼叫中或存取屬性。Tasks that throw unhandled exceptions store the resulting exception and propagate it wrapped in a in calls to or in accesses to the property. 工作執行個體是記憶體回收的時間未觀察到的任何例外狀況會在完成項執行緒上傳播。Any exceptions not observed by the time the task instance is garbage collected will be propagated on the finalizer thread. 如需詳細資訊和範例，請參閱 < [ 例外狀況處理 （工作平行程式庫）](~/docs/standard/parallel-programming/exception-handling-task-parallel-library.md)。For more information and an example, see [Exception Handling (Task Parallel Library)](~/docs/standard/parallel-programming/exception-handling-task-parallel-library.md).

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法可讓您建立和執行單一方法呼叫中的工作，而且是簡單的替代方案方法。The method allows you to create and execute a task in a single method call and is a simpler alternative to the method. 它會使用下列預設值建立一項工作：It creates a task with the following default values: - 其取消語彙基元是。Its cancellation token is . - 其屬性值是。Its property value is . - 它會使用預設工作排程器。It uses the default task scheduler. 如需處理工作作業所擲回的例外狀況資訊，請參閱[例外狀況處理](~/docs/standard/parallel-programming/exception-handling-task-parallel-library.md)。For information on handling exceptions thrown by task operations, see [Exception Handling](~/docs/standard/parallel-programming/exception-handling-task-parallel-library.md). ## Examples 下列範例會定義`ShowThreadInfo`方法，以顯示目前執行緒。The following example defines a `ShowThreadInfo` method that displays the of the current thread. 它會直接從應用程式執行緒呼叫，並從呼叫委派傳遞至方法。It is called directly from the application thread, and is called from the delegate passed to the method. [!code-csharp[System.Threading.Tasks.Task.Run#11](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task.run/cs/Run11.cs#11)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.Tasks.Task.Run#11](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task.run/vb/Run11.vb#11)] 下列範例是類似於上一個，不同之處在於它使用 lambda 運算式來定義工作可執行的程式碼。The following example is similar to the previous one, except that it uses a lambda expression to define the code that the task is to execute. [!code-csharp[System.Threading.Tasks.Task.Run#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task.run/cs/run6.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.Tasks.Task.Run#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task.run/vb/run6.vb#3)] 範例將示範非同步工作是在不同於主應用程式執行緒的執行緒上執行。The examples show that the asynchronous task executes on a different thread than the main application thread. 若要呼叫方法可確保工作完成，並顯示其應用程式結束前的輸出。The call to the method ensures that the task completes and displays its output before the application ends. 否則，它有可能，`Main`方法將會在工作完成之前完成。Otherwise, it is possible that the `Main` method will complete before the task finishes. 下列範例說明方法。The following example illustrates the method. 它會定義目錄名稱的陣列，並啟動個別的工作，來擷取每個目錄中的檔案名稱。It defines an array of directory names and starts a separate task to retrieve the file names in each directory. 所有工作將檔案名稱都寫入單一物件。All tasks write the file names to a single object. 此範例接著會呼叫方法，以確保所有工作完成時，，，然後顯示 檔案名稱寫入總數的計數物件。The example then calls the method to ensure that all tasks have completed, and then displays a count of the total number of file names written to the object. remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果工作開始執行之前，已要求取消，則不會執行工作。If cancellation is requested before the task begins execution, the task does not execute. 改為設定為狀態，並擲回例外狀況。Instead it is set to the state and throws a exception. 方法是簡單的替代方案方法。The method is a simpler alternative to the method. 它會使用下列預設值建立一項工作：It creates a task with the following default values: - 其屬性值是。Its property value is . - 它會使用預設工作排程器。It uses the default task scheduler. 如需處理工作作業所擲回的例外狀況資訊，請參閱[例外狀況處理](~/docs/standard/parallel-programming/exception-handling-task-parallel-library.md)。For information on handling exceptions thrown by task operations, see [Exception Handling](~/docs/standard/parallel-programming/exception-handling-task-parallel-library.md). ## Examples 下列範例會呼叫方法用來建立的工作，會逐一查看 C:\Windows\System32 目錄中的檔案。The following example calls the method to create a task that iterates the files in the C:\Windows\System32 directory. Lambda 運算式呼叫方法來新增每個檔案的相關資訊物件。The lambda expression calls the method to add information about each file to a object. 每個中斷連結的巢狀的工作所叫用迴圈會檢查的取消語彙基元的狀態，以及如果要求取消，則會呼叫方法。Each detached nested task invoked by the loop checks the state of the cancellation token and, if cancellation is requested, calls the method. 方法會擲回會在處理的例外狀況`catch`封鎖呼叫執行緒呼叫時方法。The method throws an exception that is handled in a `catch` block when the calling thread calls the method. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法是簡單的替代方案方法。The method is a simpler alternative to the method. 它會使用下列預設值建立一項工作：It creates a task with the following default values: - 其取消語彙基元是。Its cancellation token is . - 其屬性值是。Its property value is . - 它會使用預設工作排程器。It uses the default task scheduler. 如需處理工作作業所擲回的例外狀況資訊，請參閱[例外狀況處理](~/docs/standard/parallel-programming/exception-handling-task-parallel-library.md)。For information on handling exceptions thrown by task operations, see [Exception Handling](~/docs/standard/parallel-programming/exception-handling-task-parallel-library.md). ## Examples 下列範例會計算文字在代表已發行活頁簿的文字檔案中的近似數目。The following example counts the approximate number of words in text files that represent published books. 每個工作負責開啟檔案，以非同步的方式，讀取其完整內容，而且使用規則運算式來計算字數統計。Each task is responsible for opening a file, reading its entire contents asynchronously, and calculating the word count by using a regular expression. 會呼叫方法，以確保所有工作已都完成之前向主控台顯示每本書的字數。The method is called to ensure that all tasks have completed before displaying the word count of each book to the console. [!code-csharp[System.Threading.Tasks.Task.Run#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task.run/cs/run3.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.Tasks.Task.Run#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task.run/vb/run3.vb#2)] 規則運算式`\p{P}*\s+`比對零個、 一個或多個標點符號字元，後面接著一或多個空格字元。The regular expression `\p{P}*\s+` matches zero, one, or more punctuation characters followed by one or more white-space characters. 它會假設的相符項目總數等於大約字數。It assumes that the total number of matches equals the approximate word count.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果工作開始執行之前，已要求取消，則不會執行工作。If cancellation is requested before the task begins execution, the task does not execute. 改為設定為狀態，並擲回例外狀況。Instead it is set to the state and throws a exception. 方法是簡單的替代方案方法。The method is a simpler alternative to the method. 它會使用下列預設值建立一項工作：It creates a task with the following default values: - 其屬性值是。Its property value is . - 它會使用預設工作排程器。It uses the default task scheduler. 如需處理工作作業所擲回的例外狀況資訊，請參閱[例外狀況處理](~/docs/standard/parallel-programming/exception-handling-task-parallel-library.md)。For information on handling exceptions thrown by task operations, see [Exception Handling](~/docs/standard/parallel-programming/exception-handling-task-parallel-library.md). ## Examples 下列範例會建立 20 會執行迴圈，直到計數器會遞增為 2 百萬個值的工作。The following example creates 20 tasks that will loop until a counter is incremented to a value of 2 million. 當的前 10 個工作達到 2 百萬個，已取消的取消語彙基元，並取消其計數器尚未到達 2 百萬個的任何工作。When the first 10 tasks reach 2 million, the cancellation token is cancelled, and any tasks whose counters have not reached 2 million are cancelled. 此範例示範可能的輸出。The example shows possible output. [!code-csharp[System.Threading.Tasks.Task.Run#7](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task.run/cs/Run7.cs#7)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.Tasks.Task.Run#7](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task.run/vb/Run7.vb#7)] 而不是使用屬性可檢查例外狀況，此範例會逐一查看所有的工作，以決定它已順利完成和它已取消。Instead of using the property to examine exceptions, the example iterates all tasks to determine which have completed successfully and which have been cancelled. 對於已完成，它會顯示工作所傳回的值。For those that have completed, it displays the value returned by the task. 取消是合作式的因為每個工作可以決定如何回應取消。Because cancellation is cooperative, each task can decide how to respond to cancellation. 下列範例是第一個，類似，只不過當取消語彙基元，則工作會傳回它們已經完成而不是擲回例外狀況的次數。The following example is like the first, except that, once the token is cancelled, tasks return the number of iterations they've completed rather than throw an exception. [!code-csharp[System.Threading.Tasks.Task.Run#28](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task.run/cs/Run28.cs#28)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.Tasks.Task.Run#28](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task.run/vb/Run28.vb#28)] 此範例仍然必須處理例外狀況，因為任何尚未開始時已要求取消的工作仍會擲回的例外狀況。The example still must handle the exception, since any tasks that have not started when cancellation is requested still throw an exception.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 一般情況下，工作會在執行緒集區執行緒上以非同步方式執行，並不會封鎖呼叫執行緒。Ordinarily, tasks are executed asynchronously on a thread pool thread and do not block the calling thread. 藉由呼叫執行的工作方法會關聯到目前並且會在呼叫執行緒上執行。Tasks executed by calling the method are associated with the current and are run on the calling thread. 如果目標排程器不支援呼叫的執行緒上執行這項工作中，將排程工作，以便在排程器上執行，並呼叫的執行緒會封鎖，直到工作已完成執行為止。If the target scheduler does not support running this task on the calling thread, the task will be scheduled for execution on the scheduler, and the calling thread will block until the task has completed execution. 即使工作是以同步方式執行，仍應該呼叫呼叫的執行緒處理工作可能會擲回任何例外狀況。Even though the task runs synchronously, the calling thread should still call to handle any exceptions that the task might throw. 如需有關例外狀況處理的詳細資訊，請參閱[例外狀況處理](~/docs/standard/parallel-programming/exception-handling-task-parallel-library.md)。For more information on exception handling, see [Exception Handling](~/docs/standard/parallel-programming/exception-handling-task-parallel-library.md). 藉由呼叫執行的工作方法會藉由呼叫具現化或類別建構函式。Tasks executed by calling the method are instantiated by calling a or class constructor. 以同步方式執行工作必須在狀態。The task to be run synchronously must be in the state. 工作可能會啟動，並只執行一次。A task may be started and run only once. 若要排程的工作例外狀況的第二個階段結果的任何嘗試。Any attempts to schedule a task a second time results in an exception. ## Examples 下列範例會比較工作，藉由呼叫執行與其中一個以非同步方式執行的方法。The following example compares a task executed by calling the method with one executed asynchronously. 在這兩種情況下，工作會執行相同的 lambda 運算式，顯示工作識別碼和執行緒的 ID 上執行工作。In both cases, the tasks execute identical lambda expressions that display the task ID and the ID of the thread on which the task is running. 工作計算介於 1 到 1000000 之間的整數的總和。The task calculates the sum of the integers between 1 and 1,000,000. 如範例輸出所示，工作會執行呼叫上應用程式執行緒，而非同步工作並不會執行的方法。As the output from the example shows, the task executed by calling the method runs on the application thread, while the asynchronous task does not. [!code-csharp[System.Threading.Tasks.Task.RunSynchronously#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task.runsynchronously/cs/runsynchronously1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.Tasks.Task.RunSynchronously#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task.runsynchronously/vb/runsynchronously1.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 藉由呼叫執行的工作方法會藉由呼叫具現化或類別建構函式。Tasks executed by calling the method are instantiated by calling a or class constructor. 以同步方式執行工作必須在狀態。The task to be run synchronously must be in the state. 工作可能會啟動，並只執行一次。A task may be started and run only once. 若要排程的工作例外狀況的第二個階段結果的任何嘗試。Any attempts to schedule a task a second time results in an exception. 如果目標排程器不支援目前的執行緒上執行這項工作中，將排程工作，以便在排程器上執行，並會封鎖目前的執行緒，直到工作已完成執行。If the target scheduler does not support running this task on the current thread, the task will be scheduled for execution on the scheduler, and the current thread will block until the task has completed execution. 因為這個緣故，呼叫的執行緒不會不需要呼叫方法，例如以確保工作已完成執行。Because of this, the calling thread does not need to call a method such as to ensure that the task has completed execution. 如需有關工作作業的例外狀況處理的詳細資訊，請參閱[例外狀況處理](~/docs/standard/parallel-programming/exception-handling-task-parallel-library.md)。For more information on exception handling for task operations, see [Exception Handling](~/docs/standard/parallel-programming/exception-handling-task-parallel-library.md).

remarks.format: ## Remarks 工作可能會啟動，並只執行一次。A task may be started and run only once. 第二次排程工作的任何嘗試都會導致例外狀況。Any attempts to schedule a task a second time will result in an exception. 用來執行的工作，藉由呼叫其中一個已建立建構函式。The is used to execute a task that has been created by calling one of the constructors. 一般而言，您執行這項操作時，您需要將工作的建立，其執行，例如當您有條件地執行您已建立的工作。Typically, you do this when you need to separate the task's creation from its execution, such as when you conditionally execute tasks that you've created. 對於較常見的案例，您不需要個別執行的工作具現化，我們建議您呼叫的多載或方法。For the more common case in which you don't need to separate task instantiation from execution, we recommend that you call an overload of the or method. 如需處理工作作業所擲回的例外狀況資訊，請參閱[例外狀況處理](~/docs/standard/parallel-programming/exception-handling-task-parallel-library.md)。For information on handling exceptions thrown by task operations, see [Exception Handling](~/docs/standard/parallel-programming/exception-handling-task-parallel-library.md). ## Examples 下列範例會呼叫建構函式來具現化新物件，會顯示其工作識別碼和 managed 的執行緒識別碼，並接著就執行迴圈。The following example calls the constructor to instantiate a new object that displays its task ID and managed thread ID and then executes a loop. 然後它會呼叫方法來執行工作。It then calls the method to execute the task. 由於這是主控台應用程式，以呼叫方法是為了防止應用程式終止之前執行的工作完成。Since this is a console app, the call to the method is necessary to prevent the app from terminating before the task finishes execution. [!code-csharp[System.Threading.Tasks.Task.Start#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task.start/cs/Start1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.Tasks.Task.Start#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task.start/vb/Start1.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 擷取的值屬性不會封鎖呼叫執行緒，直到工作完成為止。Retrieving the value of the property does not block the calling thread until the task has completed. 如需詳細資訊和範例，請參閱 < [ 使用接續工作鏈結工作](~/docs/standard/parallel-programming/chaining-tasks-by-using-continuation-tasks.md)並[如何： 取消工作及其子系](~/docs/standard/parallel-programming/how-to-cancel-a-task-and-its-children.md)。For more information and an example, see [Chaining Tasks by Using Continuation Tasks](~/docs/standard/parallel-programming/chaining-tasks-by-using-continuation-tasks.md) and [How to: Cancel a Task and Its Children](~/docs/standard/parallel-programming/how-to-cancel-a-task-and-its-children.md). ## Examples 下列範例會建立 20 會執行迴圈，直到計數器會遞增為 2 百萬個值的工作。The following example creates 20 tasks that will loop until a counter is incremented to a value of 2 million. 當的前 10 個工作達到 2 百萬個，已取消的取消語彙基元，並取消其計數器尚未到達 2 百萬個的任何工作。When the first 10 tasks reach 2 million, the cancellation token is cancelled, and any tasks whose counters have not reached 2 million are cancelled. 此範例接著會檢查屬性指出是否已順利完成，或已取消每項工作。The example then examines the property of each task to indicate whether it completed successfully or was cancelled. 對於已完成，它會顯示工作所傳回的值。For those that completed, it displays the value returned by the task. [!code-csharp[System.Threading.Tasks.Task.Run#7](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task.run/cs/Run7.cs#7)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.Tasks.Task.Run#7](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task.run/vb/Run7.vb#7)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 會造成呼叫執行緒等候，直到目前的工作已完成同步處理方法。 is a synchronization method that causes the calling thread to wait until the current task has completed. 如果目前的工作尚未啟動執行，等候方法會嘗試從排程器中移除此工作，並執行它內嵌在目前的執行緒上。If the current task has not started execution, the Wait method attempts to remove the task from the scheduler and execute it inline on the current thread. 如果無法這麼做，或目前的工作已經開始執行，它會封鎖呼叫執行緒直到工作完成。If it is unable to do that, or if the current task has already started execution, it blocks the calling thread until the task completes. 如需詳細資訊，請參閱 < [Task.Wait 和 「 內嵌 」](http://blogs.msdn.com/b/pfxteam/archive/2009/10/15/9907713.aspx)中平行程式設計與.NET 部落格。For more information, see [Task.Wait and "Inlining"](http://blogs.msdn.com/b/pfxteam/archive/2009/10/15/9907713.aspx) in the Parallel Programming with .NET blog. ## Examples 下列範例會啟動的工作，會產生介於 0 到 100 之間的 1 百萬個亂數，並計算其平均值。The following example starts a task that generates one million random integers between 0 and 100 and computes their mean. 此範例會使用方法，以確保應用程式終止之前，工作會完成。The example uses the method to ensure that the task completes before the application terminates. 否則因為這是一個主控台應用程式時，範例會終止之前的工作可以計算並顯示平均值。Otherwise, because this is a console application, the example would terminate before the task can compute and display the mean. remarks.format: ## Remarks 是一種同步處理方法造成呼叫執行緒等待目前的工作執行個體完成，直到發生下列其中一項： is a synchronization method that causes the calling thread to wait for the current task instance to complete until one of the following occurs: - 在工作順利完成。The task completes successfully. - 工作本身已取消或擲回例外狀況。The task itself is canceled or throws an exception. 在此情況下，您處理例外狀況。In this case, you handle an exception. 屬性包含有關例外狀況或例外狀況詳細資料。The property contains details about the exception or exceptions. - 所定義的間隔`millisecondsTimeout`耗盡。The interval defined by `millisecondsTimeout` elapses. 在此情況下，目前的執行緒會繼續執行，而且此方法會傳回`false`。In this case, the current thread resumes execution and the method returns `false`. ## Examples 下列範例會啟動的工作，會產生 5 百萬個隨機整數，介於 0 到 100 之間，並計算其平均值。The following example starts a task that generates five million random integers between 0 and 100 and computes their mean. 此範例會使用方法等候 150 毫秒內完成應用程式。The example uses the method to wait for the application to complete within 150 milliseconds. 如果應用程式正常完成，工作會顯示 sum 和它產生隨機數字的平均值。If the application completes normally, the task displays the sum and mean of the random numbers that it has generated. 如果經過逾時間隔，這個範例會顯示一則訊息，它終止之前。If the timeout interval has elapsed, the example displays a message before it terminates. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法會建立可取消等待，也就是它會導致目前的執行緒等候，直到發生下列其中一項：The method creates a cancelable wait; that is, it causes the current thread to wait until one of the following occurs: - 在工作完成。The task completes. - 已取消的取消語彙基元。The cancellation token is canceled. 在此情況下，呼叫方法會擲回。In this case, the call to the method throws an . > [!NOTE] > 正在取消`cancellationToken`取消語彙基元已不會影響執行中的工作，除非它也被傳遞取消語彙基元，而且已準備好處理取消作業。Canceling the `cancellationToken` cancellation token has no effect on the running task unless it has also been passed the cancellation token and is prepared to handle cancellation. 傳遞`cancellationToken`物件給此方法只可取消等待。Passing the `cancellationToken` object to this method simply allows the wait to be canceled. ## Examples 下列範例說明簡單的使用取消語彙基元取消等待工作完成。The following example illustrates the simple use of a cancellation token to cancel waiting for a task's completion. 工作啟動時，會呼叫方法來取消任何語彙基元來源取消語彙基元，然後延遲五秒。A task is launched, calls the method to cancel any of the token source's cancellation tokens, and then delays for five seconds. 請注意，工作本身不被傳遞取消語彙基元，便無法取消。Note that the task itself has not been passed the cancellation token and is not cancelable. 應用程式執行緒呼叫的工作方法等候工作完成，但是等候已取消後已取消的取消語彙基元和就會擲回。The application thread calls the task's method to wait for the task to complete, but the wait is canceled once the cancellation token is cancelled and an is thrown. 例外狀況處理常式回報例外狀況，並接著會進入睡眠狀態六秒。The exception handler reports the exception and then sleeps for six seconds. 如範例輸出所示，這種延遲可讓工作在完成狀態。As the output from the example shows, that delay allows the task to complete in the state. remarks.format: ## Remarks 是一種同步處理方法造成呼叫執行緒等待目前的工作執行個體完成，直到發生下列其中一項： is a synchronization method that causes the calling thread to wait for the current task instance to complete until one of the following occurs: - 在工作順利完成。The task completes successfully. - 工作本身已取消或擲回例外狀況。The task itself is canceled or throws an exception. 在此情況下，您處理例外狀況。In this case, you handle an exception. 屬性包含有關例外狀況或例外狀況詳細資料。The property contains details about the exception or exceptions. - `cancellationToken`取消語彙基元已取消。The `cancellationToken` cancellation token is canceled. 在此情況下，呼叫方法會擲回。In this case, the call to the method throws an . - 所定義的間隔`millisecondsTimeout`耗盡。The interval defined by `millisecondsTimeout` elapses. 在此情況下，目前的執行緒會繼續執行，而且此方法會傳回`false`。In this case, the current thread resumes execution and the method returns `false`. > [!NOTE] > 正在取消`cancellationToken`取消語彙基元已不會影響執行中的工作，除非它也被傳遞取消語彙基元，而且已準備好處理取消作業。Canceling the `cancellationToken` cancellation token has no effect on the running task unless it has also been passed the cancellation token and is prepared to handle cancellation. 傳遞`cancellationToken`物件給此方法只允許取消等待基礎上的某些條件。Passing the `cancellationToken` object to this method simply allows the wait to be canceled based on some condition. ## Examples 下列範例會呼叫方法，以提供的逾時值和取消語彙基元可以結束等候工作完成。The following example calls the method to provide both a timeout value and a cancellation token that can end the wait for a task's completion. 新的執行緒已啟動並執行`CancelToken`方法，其中會暫停，然後呼叫方法來取消取消語彙基元。A new thread is started and executes the `CancelToken` method, which pauses and then calls the method to cancel the cancellation tokens. 工作是然後啟動，就會延遲 5 秒鐘。A task is then launched and delays for 5 seconds. 方法接著會呼叫等待工作完成，並提供簡短的逾時值和取消語彙基元。The method is then called to wait for the task's completion and is provided both a brief timeout value and a cancellation token. remarks.format: ## Remarks 多載方法會傳回您感興趣的一組工作的狀態或一組工作所擲回的例外狀況時，通常會呼叫物件。The overloads of the method that return a object are typically called when you are interested in the status of a set of tasks or in the exceptions thrown by a set of tasks. > [!NOTE] > 若要呼叫方法不會封鎖呼叫執行緒。The call to method does not block the calling thread. 如果任何提供的工作完成處於錯誤狀態時，傳回的工作也會完成在其例外狀況會在其中包含未包裝的例外狀況，從每個提供的工作集的彙總的狀態。If any of the supplied tasks completes in a faulted state, the returned task will also complete in a state, where its exceptions will contain the aggregation of the set of unwrapped exceptions from each of the supplied tasks. 如果沒有提供的工作發生錯誤，但至少其中一個已取消，則傳回的工作便會在結束狀態。If none of the supplied tasks faulted but at least one of them was canceled, the returned task will end in the state. 如果沒有任何工作發生錯誤，則工作已取消，產生的工作便會在結束狀態。If none of the tasks faulted and none of the tasks were canceled, the resulting task will end in the state. 如果提供陣列/可列舉不包含任何工作，傳回的工作就會立即轉換成狀態，再將它傳回給呼叫端。If the supplied array/enumerable contains no tasks, the returned task will immediately transition to a state before it's returned to the caller. ## Examples 下列範例會建立一組的陣列中的 Url 執行 ping 命令的工作。The following example creates a set of tasks that ping the URLs in an array. 這些工作會儲存在`List`集合傳遞給方法。The tasks are stored in a `List` collection that is passed to the method. 若要在呼叫之後方法可確保所有的執行緒已完成，此範例會檢查屬性來判斷是否有錯誤的任何工作。After the call to the method ensures that all threads have completed, the example examines the property to determine whether any tasks have faulted. remarks.format: ## Remarks 若要呼叫方法不會封鎖呼叫執行緒。The call to method does not block the calling thread. 不過，所傳回的呼叫屬性會封鎖呼叫執行緒。However, a call to the returned property does block the calling thread. 如果任何提供的工作完成處於錯誤狀態時，傳回的工作也會完成在其例外狀況會在其中包含未包裝的例外狀況，從每個提供的工作集的彙總的狀態。If any of the supplied tasks completes in a faulted state, the returned task will also complete in a state, where its exceptions will contain the aggregation of the set of unwrapped exceptions from each of the supplied tasks. 如果沒有提供的工作發生錯誤，但至少其中一個已取消，則傳回的工作便會在結束狀態。If none of the supplied tasks faulted but at least one of them was canceled, the returned task will end in the state. 如果沒有任何工作發生錯誤，則工作已取消，產生的工作便會在結束狀態。If none of the tasks faulted and none of the tasks were canceled, the resulting task will end in the state. 屬性傳回的工作將會設定為陣列，包含所有以相同順序提供的工作結果，它們所提供 (例如如果輸入工作包含陣列 t1，t2，t3，輸出工作的屬性會傳回`TResult[]`其中`arr[0] == t1.Result, arr[1] == t2.Result, and arr[2] == t3.Result)`。The property of the returned task will be set to an array containing all of the results of the supplied tasks in the same order as they were provided (e.g. if the input tasks array contained t1, t2, t3, the output task's property will return an `TResult[]` where `arr[0] == t1.Result, arr[1] == t2.Result, and arr[2] == t3.Result)`. 如果`tasks`引數包含任何工作，傳回的工作就會立即轉換成狀態，再將它傳回給呼叫端。If the `tasks` argument contains no tasks, the returned task will immediately transition to a state before it's returned to the caller. 傳回`TResult[]`就會是陣列的項目 0。The returned `TResult[]` will be an array of 0 elements. ## Examples 下列範例會建立 10 個工作，其中每個具現化的隨機數字產生器建立 1,000 個介於 1 到 1000 之間的亂數，並計算其平均值。The following example creates ten tasks, each of which instantiates a random number generator that creates 1,000 random numbers between 1 and 1,000 and computes their mean. 方法用來延遲具現化的亂數產生器，使它們不會建立具有相同的種子值。The method is used to delay instantiation of the random number generators so that they are not created with identical seed values. 若要在呼叫方法接著會傳回陣列，其中包含平均值計算每一項工作。The call to the method then returns an array that contains the mean computed by each task. 這些會接著用來計算整體的平均數。These are then used to calculate the overall mean. [!code-csharp[System.Threading.Tasks.Task.WhenAll#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task.whenall/cs/whenall1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.Tasks.Task.WhenAll#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.threading.tasks.task.whenall/vb/whenall1.vb#1)] 在此情況下，將 10 個個別的工作儲存在物件。In this case, the ten individual tasks are stored in a object. 會實作 介面。 implements the interface.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 若要呼叫方法不會封鎖呼叫執行緒。The call to method does not block the calling thread. 不過，所傳回的呼叫屬性會封鎖呼叫執行緒。However, a call to the returned property does block the calling thread. 如果任何提供的工作完成處於錯誤狀態時，傳回的工作也會完成在其例外狀況會在其中包含未包裝的例外狀況，從每個提供的工作集的彙總的狀態。If any of the supplied tasks completes in a faulted state, the returned task will also complete in a state, where its exceptions will contain the aggregation of the set of unwrapped exceptions from each of the supplied tasks. 如果沒有提供的工作發生錯誤，但至少其中一個已取消，則傳回的工作便會在結束狀態。If none of the supplied tasks faulted but at least one of them was canceled, the returned task will end in the state. 如果沒有任何工作發生錯誤，則工作已取消，產生的工作便會在結束狀態。If none of the tasks faulted and none of the tasks were canceled, the resulting task will end in the state. 傳回的工作將會設定為陣列，包含所有以相同順序提供的工作結果，它們所提供 (例如如果輸入工作包含陣列 t1，t2，t3，輸出工作會傳回`TResult[]`其中`arr[0] == t1.Result, arr[1] == t2.Result, and arr[2] == t3.Result)`。The of the returned task will be set to an array containing all of the results of the supplied tasks in the same order as they were provided (e.g. if the input tasks array contained t1, t2, t3, the output task's will return an `TResult[]` where `arr[0] == t1.Result, arr[1] == t2.Result, and arr[2] == t3.Result)`. 如果提供陣列/可列舉不包含任何工作，傳回的工作就會立即轉換成狀態，再將它傳回給呼叫端。If the supplied array/enumerable contains no tasks, the returned task will immediately transition to a state before it's returned to the caller. 傳回`TResult[]`就會是陣列的項目 0。The returned `TResult[]` will be an array of 0 elements. ## Examples 下列範例會建立 10 個工作，其中每個具現化的隨機數字產生器建立 1,000 個介於 1 到 1000 之間的亂數，並計算其平均值。The following example creates ten tasks, each of which instantiates a random number generator that creates 1,000 random numbers between 1 and 1,000 and computes their mean. 在此情況下，將 10 個個別的工作儲存在`Task`陣列。In this case, the ten individual tasks are stored in a `Task` array. 方法用來延遲具現化的亂數產生器，使它們不會建立具有相同的種子值。The method is used to delay instantiation of the random number generators so that they are not created with identical seed values. 若要在呼叫方法接著會傳回陣列，其中包含平均值計算每一項工作。The call to the method then returns an array that contains the mean computed by each task. 這些會接著用來計算整體的平均數。These are then used to calculate the overall mean. remarks.format: ## Remarks 傳回的工作會完成時提供的任何的工作已完成。The returned task will complete when any of the supplied tasks has completed. 傳回的工作將一律會在結束`RanToCompletion`狀態設定為第一項工作，以完成其結果。The returned task will always end in the `RanToCompletion` state with its Result set to the first task to complete. 這是，則為 true，即使在第一個工作完成結束`Canceled`或`Faulted`狀態。This is true even if the first task to complete ended in the `Canceled` or `Faulted` state.

summary.span: 建立會在等候時以非同步方式遞交 (Yield) 給目前內容的 awaitable 工具。

span.span: Creates an awaitable task that asynchronously yields back to the current context when awaited.

returns.span: 內容，這個內容會在受到等候時非同步轉換回等候當時的最新內容。

span.span: A context that, when awaited, will asynchronously transition back into the current context at the time of the await.

returns.span: 如果目前的 非 null，即視為目前的內容。

span.span: If the current is non-null, it is treated as the current context.

returns.span: 否則，將與目前執行之工作相關聯的工作排程器視為目前的內容。

span.span: Otherwise, the task scheduler that is associated with the currently executing task is treated as the current context.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 您可以使用`await Task.Yield();`中非同步的方法，以強制以非同步方式完成的方法。You can use `await Task.Yield();` in an asynchronous method to force the method to complete asynchronously. 如果沒有目前的同步處理內容 (物件)，這將會公佈回該內容的方法執行的其餘部分。If there is a current synchronization context ( object), this will post the remainder of the method’s execution back to that context. 不過，內容會決定如何設定此工作相對於其他可能在擱置中的工作優先權。However, the context will decide how to prioritize this work relative to other work that may be pending. 存在於 UI 執行緒大部分的 UI 環境中的同步處理內容通常會排定優先順序高於輸入和轉譯工作的內容發佈的工作。The synchronization context that is present on a UI thread in most UI environments will often prioritize work posted to the context higher than input and rendering work. 基於這個理由，請勿依賴`await Task.Yield();`以保留 UI 回應性。For this reason, do not rely on `await Task.Yield();` to keep a UI responsive. 如需詳細資訊，請參閱文章[有用的抽象概念啟用 ContinueWith](http://blogs.msdn.com/b/pfxteam/archive/2008/07/23/8768673.aspx)中平行程式設計與.NET 部落格。For more information, see the entry [Useful Abstractions Enabled with ContinueWith](http://blogs.msdn.com/b/pfxteam/archive/2008/07/23/8768673.aspx) in the Parallel Programming with .NET blog.
